author: m77w
body: 200% on Citrix and Teladoc calls today already. Sit tight or sell?

author: MustWarn0thers
body:
I'm as 🌈 a 🐻 as they come from the standpoint of eviscerated economic activity, self and mandated quarantines etc, but Citrix hasn't been red on any time scale that covers the lead up to this pandemic.

While fully retarded, I also know that earnings aren't driving individual stocks as much as the market whole is, but does anyone think CTXS calls for after earnings on 4/22 are looking OK?

They'll more than likely be busting EPS for 1st quarter and even more for 2nd with companies scrambling to implement their WFH infrastructure. I work for a 5 billion+ credit union and we've spent tons in the past few months getting ready for our non-IT staff to be ready to work from their home pcs.

author: kingmathers12
body: Lol this is exactly why I've stayed away from SPY puts.  My puts have been company specific.  The initial drop was ridiculous seeing as how a lot of companies in s&p won't be affected but the entire index fell as people dumped mutual funds then started to correct as people snatched up companies who will perform better or at least on par as they did before the news.  This correction is still happening as companies adapt and show liquidity to weather the storm.  TLDR - $SPY 280C 4/13,  $CTXS 145C 5/1 $LYFT 22P 4/24 $AMD 50C 4/17

author: sixersinnj
body: Calls on Zoom or Citrix. WOrk from home surge. Thoughts??

Holding it for $125 price target.

author: programmingguy
body:
yeah, they are assumptions but it's safe to assume we will reach peak Kovid19 at some point. Then the question is how long the downturn would last... all over by Christmas season? effects felt all the way into next summer? triggers a decade of stagflation and NIRP? who knows. I can afford to take the risk. Will be a buyer at different levels while the stock market goes through a rout.

Tech: GOOG, MSFT, ADBE, TEAM, FB, NOW, CTXS, DOCU

Financials: V, MA, AXP, JPM, PYPL

Healthcare: MDT, HCA

Discretionary: SBUX, DNKN, DIS.... will buy into these after peak Kovid19

Trading: IBM sell at 130

body: Someone commented that same day she also bought shares of Citrix.. which is used for telecommuting and stuff. They’re actually up slightly 🤔🤔

author: Cocaine_Addiction
body:
China doesn't have much of a semiconductor industry. They're totally dependent on American tech.

MU has proven that semiconductors can weather the supply chain disruptions and have been raking in the cheddar as cloud providers and remote work enterprises like Citrix increase their loading. As lockdowns unwind and consumer spending comes back into play all of these semis are likely to rebound more quickly than any other industry.

AMA

author: Miragey
body:
I think they have a citrix client for tablets.

I'm not saying it to say, it really does suck.

Example. Let's say an option opens at 2.00, at the time you buy it's lets say 3.00 and you buy 10.  The app will show you +1.00 (or however it moves, based on the open all day) on each option for the remainder of the trading day. Even though you started at a different price from open.

Is your account balance right? Yes it is. But you almost need to know what you paid if you want to day trade. If not, it's back and forth to the order history, which sucks to filter and figure out how you might be doing.

If you are going to long date options, the next day, everything is good.

Thanks for coming to my SCHWAB talk.

author: el_terrible_
body:
right and she also bought citrix.  just a coincidence and her advisor normally just dumps 3 million in a day and doesnt tell her about it.

author: IAlwaysLoveThatOne
body:
CNBC has been shilling this company for weeks. I don't know enough about it, but I agree Microsoft (Skype) is probably a better bet for the WFH crowd.

Maybe Citrix for VPN too?

author: DanversOfManderley
body:
Interesting. Thurs/Fri will get wild due to unemployment numbers you think? 

Isn't Citrix that telework service one of the senators bought into after they sold off their stock? You think it'll go nutty with all the press? I'll keep an eye on VMW for sure.

author: SeattleBattles
body:
It's not like the crisis was a secret at that point. Plenty of asset managers and investors were taking small positions in companies like that. 

Citrix wasn't even a good investment in that space. They are barely up at all since it was purchased.

author: Itpeewhenithurt
body: Cisco? Citrix? Microsoft?

author: RobertMuldoonfromJP

If true, further proof that regardless of political stripes, all politicians have potential for being corrupt.

What a piece of shit. The Citrix position just feels like a big fuck you.

author: lawdawg1111
body: The question is, is Citrix worth investing?

author: catchyphrase
body: 90% chance I do no new plays but watch my current plays, which are spread out and see what the world situation is like. Without knowing what the weekend holds for virus stats, I think it’s going to be a low volume week until perhaps Thu/Fri. I expect 10% swings which are not worth touching. I’m thinking this through as I type, and I think what I’m going to do is narrow down which specific company stocks I want to buy for a decade long hold along with SPY and start cost averaging my way into them. That being said - keep an eye out on ZM, Citrix, VMW. first two, fun for reckless trading, last one is a good long term buy.

author: SweetPot-tay-toes
body:
A play that I haven't seen posted, but I will not pursue myself, are companies like Citrix that allow for remote access and work from home providers.

Looks like Citrix is up a bit, but not so much that the play looks crowded.

Long term, work from home capacity is going to be far more prevalent than it is now, I think, even just as emergency preparedness.
